intro: Chonemorpha parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered chonemorpha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
